intro: Psathyrotopsis scaposa, commonly known as the scapose psathyrotopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Psathyrotopsis scaposa is typically found in moist, shaded habitats at higher elevations.
